advantages: Simple to implement and understand, making it a good educational tool.
Does not require any additional memory for storage (in-place searching).
Can be used on unsorted or unordered lists without any preprocessing.
disadvantages: Inefficient for large datasets with a worst-case time complexity of O(n).
Not suitable for performance-critical applications compared to more efficient search algorithms like binary search.
Requires scanning each element in the dataset, leading to potentially high execution times for large lists.
